summary: EchoFactyt — a bright, modern, mobile-friendly content website for teens and young adults focused on short facts, life hacks, and useful tips covering technology, school, health, entertainment, and daily life.
architectural_notes: Design must be clean, colorful, SEO-friendly, fast-loading, and fully mobile-responsive with bold headings and modern fonts
Email subscription form is UI-only (no actual email sending); downloadable freebies use placeholder links
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Vibrant hero illustration with colorful abstract shapes, lightning bolt, lightbulb, and stars on a coral-to-yellow gradient background, suitable for a youth facts website (hero-banner.dim_1400x600.png)
- Fun flat-style icons set: small icons for technology (chip), school (book), health (heart), entertainment (star), daily life (sun) on transparent backgrounds (category-icons.dim_512x512.png)
- Bright decorative freebie download card background with confetti and ribbon elements (freebies-bg.dim_800x400.png)

existing_features.title: Design and apply a vibrant, youthful visual theme across the entire site: bold gradient accents (e.g., coral-to-yellow or teal-to-lime), modern sans-serif typography (large bold headings, readable body text), colorful category badges, card-based layout, smooth hover effects, and fully responsive mobile-first layout. No blue/purple.

Build a full-width hero banner at the top of the homepage with a catchy tagline (e.g., 'Discover Facts That Actually Matter'), a short subtitle, and three CTA buttons: 'Learn More', 'Try Now', and 'Watch Video'. The banner should use a bold gradient background and a generated hero illustration.

Create a 'Trending Facts' section displaying at least 6 colorful fact cards. Each card shows a category badge, a short interesting fact (2–3 sentences), a topic icon, and a 'Learn More' button. Facts should span categories: technology, school, health, entertainment, and daily life.

Add a 'Top 10 Lists' section with at least 3 sample Top 10 lists (e.g., 'Top 10 Study Hacks', 'Top 10 Free Apps for Students', 'Top 10 Healthy Snacks'). Each list is shown as a numbered card or accordion panel with a title, brief description, and a 'Try Now' CTA button.

Create a 'Step-by-Step Guides' section with at least 3 sample guides (e.g., 'How to Build a Study Schedule', 'How to Stay Healthy on a Budget'). Each guide is displayed as a card with a title, numbered steps, and a 'Learn More' button.

Build a 'Videos' section that embeds YouTube Shorts and videos. Use iframe embeds with a visually appealing grid or carousel layout. Include at least 4 embedded video placeholders using real YouTube embed URLs (e.g., popular EchoFactyt-style short educational videos). Each video card should have a title and a 'Watch Video' button/label.

Add an interactive Quiz module with at least one sample quiz (e.g., 'Which Study Style Are You?'). The quiz should present multiple-choice questions one at a time, track the user's answers in React state, and display a results screen at the end with a score or personality result.

Include at least 2 interactive calculators in a 'Calculators' section: (1) a GPA Calculator that takes course grades and credit hours and outputs a GPA, and (2) a Screen Time Tracker calculator that estimates daily digital wellness based on hours of screen time input. Both calculators must use React state for all computation.

Create a 'Free Downloads' section with at least 4 freebie cards (e.g., 'Study Planner PDF', 'Healthy Meal Prep Checklist', 'Daily Habit Tracker', 'Tech Cheat Sheet'). Each card shows a title, description, and a 'Download Free' button. Buttons link to placeholder '#' or a static notice since file hosting is not available.

Add social media share buttons (Twitter/X, Facebook, WhatsApp, and Copy Link) on each fact card, guide card, and at the bottom of the quiz results screen. Clicking Twitter/X and Facebook should open a pre-filled share dialog using the page URL and a short share message. WhatsApp should open a whatsapp.com share link. Copy Link copies the current URL to clipboard.

Build a 'Popular Posts' sidebar or section showing at least 5 posts ranked by a view count stored in the Motoko backend. Each post has a title, category, and view count. Clicking a post increments its view count via a backend call.

Add a 'New Updates' section on the homepage displaying the most recently added facts or tips. The backend should store content items with a timestamp. The frontend fetches and displays the 4 most recent items in a highlighted 'New' badge card layout.

Implement a topic category filter/navigation bar with tabs or pill buttons for: All, Technology, School, Health, Entertainment, Daily Life. Clicking a category filters the Trending Facts, Guides, and Top 10 lists sections to show only items matching that category. Filter state is managed in React.

Trending facts section with colorful cards
Category sections: Technology, School, Health, Entertainment, Daily Life
Useful calculators (e.g., GPA, sleep, screen time)
Embedded YouTube Shorts/videos from EchoFactyt channel with visually appealing video section
Downloadable freebies section with download buttons
Popular posts and new updates sections
